Package mickel.util

Class Summary
DataInspector This class provides users with the ability to dynamically view real-time values for each data field of an object as a program is running.
RuntimeErrorDialog Displays an informative, graphical dialog indicating the occurrence of , a runtime error allowing the user to either "Debug", "Resume", or "Exit" the program.

If enabled (default), the "Debug" option will allow the end-user to launch a DataInspector that will allow them to view the real-time values of all data fields for the specified root object.

In order to use this class, simply invoke it's constructor during the catch block of a try-catch statement, passing in a reference to the Exception (or Error) and a reference to the root object whose data you might like to examine.

try
{
  // ...code that might throw an Exception not shown...
}
catch (Exception e)
{
  new RuntimeError(e, this);
}
